comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Perhaps the professor who was described in NYT of Feb 19, 1916 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F3081EFC345C13738... as saying, "Climate governs and determines the success, assimiliation, and progress of this country's new citizens, and any form of Americanization that leaves out this vital and controlling factor is without avail, according to a paper read by Dr. Austin O'Malley tonight in Houston Hall." The speech was in Philadelphia on Feb 18, 1916.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
66311327@N05
comment._content: He predicted that in that in 40 years (from 1921 on), the blonds would have been vanished in the USA, see The Bismarck tribune., November 08, 1921, Image 8, with photo. He was the author of the "Keystones of Thought" - "the only book of original and genuine aphorisms in English. Written by the World's master of aphoristic thought and expression." (The sun., October 12, 1919, Section 6 Books and the Book World, Page 3, advertising)
